name: territoriality
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the behaviour that a person or an animal uses to defend its territory (= an area that an animal or person tries to control or thinks belongs to them): The males of the species exhibit territoriality, especially when other males come close to their homes. These were issues of territoriality, and he just wasn't going to accept challenges to his authority.
the state of being a territory (= an area of land, or sometimes sea, that is considered as belonging to, or connected with a particular country or person): Territoriality means that the laws of the country have force only within that country's territory. Trans-border searches might violate the international principle of territoriality.
More examplesFewer examplesTerritoriality was often the key to urban working-class sporting loyalties. A wild animal will demonstrate territoriality, often by spraying its urine in the area that it is claiming.
